characters: I JUST WANT TO BE DOWN HERE ALONE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a bitter cold January morning. The woods are quiet. Desolate. In the far off distance a man is jogging. He ba around the end of a small pond and runs right at us. This MIKE FLAHERTY, FORTY-TWO. He is running hard. Or at least hard as he can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly TWO JOGGERS blow past him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HOME MADE STAIN GLASS ANGEL hangs on a window. It falls the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABBY FLAHERTY, SIX-YEARS OLD, stirs and gets out of her b out. She picks up the Bird and inspects it. It's broken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE FLAHERTY, THIRTY-SEVEN is still sleeping. Abby wal into the room. Jackie opens her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy, can we play croquet today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackie lifts Abby onto the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Daddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackie smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STELLA, TWO YEARS OLD is standing up in her crib crying. comes in and picks her up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. OK. Hi there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackie prepares some food. She knocks a glass over into t sink and it breaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks over at Abby who is immersed in her coloring. T she sets the food down in front of Stella who is sitting high chair. Mike enters wearing a suit and tie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How was the run?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. It was good. Abby, finish your cereal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm very impressed with you keeping it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike shrugs and takes a yogurt from the refrigerator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do too, so stop drawing and eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What brand is this? Daddy, look. It's your team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're all the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike looks at the drawing. It looks nothing like a team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my team? That's great, honey. Are they winning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you should show the team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby knocks over a glass of water. It spills onto the drawing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, you can't use that word. It's a bad word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Mike's look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Don't look at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh. Bye sweetie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses Abby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye daddy. Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. You OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I'm good. Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just checking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. Bye guy's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I have more juice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike leaves. Jackie is not convinced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike walks outside toward his car. He opens the car door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike turns. Jackie is standing at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you call Fenn about the tree?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I will today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please do. I don't want it coming down on the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike looks at a VERY DEAD TREE in the side yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. You're right. I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you too, sweetie. Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackie shuts the door. Mike looks up at the tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike pays for his coffee and bagel and starts to leave. H nods to a group of FIVE OLD MEN who wave him over. He tri to keep moving but they continue to engage him. Finally h joins the table. The group shares a laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike's car pulls into a driveway of an OLD HOUSE that has been converted into TWO OFFICES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SIGN on the lawn reads: "MICHAEL S. FLAHERTY, COUNSELOR LAW" and "STEPHEN VIGMAN, CPA"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike parks his car as a WORKMAN walks up from the basemen the house and gets into his VAN and pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike gets out of his car and walks toward the back door carrying his briefcase. He stops at the basement steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vig?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike walks down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an old, musty basement filled with endless shelves o files.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up, Vig?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donna's out sick and can't find anything without her. It sucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN VIGMAN, FIFTY, emerges carrying some files.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was that guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that sucks more. He's the plumber. I called him to look at that piece of crap of boiler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vigman points to an ANCIENT HOT WATER BOILER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That clanking is driving me nuts. Can't you hear it down in your office?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I just figured it's old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well it is but he took one look at it and said we should replace it before it blows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! We just had it fixed three months ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, he said that job was crap. The guy did crap work. Can you believe that? That little scumbag!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. All they care about is getting paid. Makes me sick. No one wants to do the work anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much to fix it, Vig? Did he say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six grand to replace everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me about it. I gotta be honest, Mike, it's not a good time for me. My business is off and my step son wants to get Lasik.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Isn't he too young?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't really care at this point. If it makes him happy, he can have it. I get nothing from that kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. He has an unnatural attachment to his father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. So what do you want to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I was thinking we could leave it for now and just cover the file cabinets in plastic to be safe. How about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I guess I'm good with that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLANK. CLANK. CLANK. The boiler barks. They both jump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get out of here before it blows. I'll pick some up plastic before practice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both hurry back up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike walks into his office. SHELLY, the receptionist, is her computer working. She's mid-20s and pure Jersey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Shelly, How you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a little hung over and my boyfriend's a moron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Sorry to hear that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd the team do last night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bummer. Your noon canceled so you just have a 10:30 and 3pm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. Anything else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The toilet isn't flushing again. Should I just call someone this time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'll take a look at it. Who do I have at ten-thirty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike is sitting with FRANK, an elderly man, jotting notes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you think your son stole it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I know he did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would he steal your cat, Frank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's jealous of her. Very jealous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike is on his phone as he cleans his keyboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand but that's my fee for that particular service. Uh huh. Right. Well maybe I can adjust that a little bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike is eating lunch at his desk. He hears a noise and lo out the back window and see's Vigman pulling a LARGE ROLL PLASTIC TARP out of the trunk of his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike, on his knees, plunges the broken toilet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike is sitting with LEO POPLAR, 82 and his HOME HEALTH A JOLIE, FORTY-FIVE and AFRICAN AMERICAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well Leo, remember you got lost and the police had to help you a few times. That's why we brought Jolie into help you, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So now what happens?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well if that Judge deems you incapacitated then you will need a guardian. And if we can't find your daughter then the state...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can't find herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK but if we can't find her then the State will have to become your guardian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's the state?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know...the state...of New Jersey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's crazy. I don't need New Jersey's help. I got Jolie now. And there's no funny business between us so you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. I'm sure there's not. Let's just first see if we can find your daughter and then we'll go from there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHELLY flips through some DOCUMENTS. The boiler sounds of CLANK CLANK CLANK. She jumps. She picks up the documents walks into Mike's office setting the documents down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I still hung over or is that noise getting louder?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're probably still hung over. What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leo's financial statements. He's loaded, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, he is. You find his daughter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. That lady is gone and doesn't want to be found.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike takes the STATEMENTS and puts them in LEO'S FILE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't the state just leave him in his home? That's what the guy wants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They could but they never will. It's too much work. They'll probably move him into Oak Knoll. Hand me one of their brochures?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly grabs an OAK KNOLL BROCHURE from a stack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he has Jolie now. She can handle it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, she can't. His guardian still has to make every single decision. It's the difference between a baby sitter and a parent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands it to Mike who takes it and paper clips in on t inside of Leo's file.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I could do it. I could use an extra 1,500 bucks a month.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: $1,500. Is that what it is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. It's in his file. (Answering the phone) Mike Flaherty's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike opens Leo's file.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Vigman are coaching wrestling practice at the pu highschool. They are in the small, dingy back gym just of the main gymnasium. This is a no-frills program.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The team of 12 WRESTLERS are doing a spinning drill. Vigm holds up a singlet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whose singlet is this? What did I say about leaving them around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WRESTLER runs over and Vig flings it at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and TERRY DELFINO are running. Terry is the same age Mike but dressed in a better gear. They are both breathin hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's the team doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell happened? We used to be good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well we're not anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we walk for a bit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both stop. Terry is completely winded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sucked. You're running good, buddy. Kicking my ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry's blackberry beeps. He takes it out and reads it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I've been getting out here a bit more often.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta be kidding me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori's texting me at seven in the morning to ask me if I want an antique sewing table that we bought together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I want my fucking house back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she still with that guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean my contractor? The guy I hired? Yeah, she is. I can just picture that little scumbag walking around my house wearing his tool belt. Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands Mike his blackberry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a picture for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry pulls down his pants and moons Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it! Jesus, Ter!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry! It's cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike takes the picture. Terry takes the blackberry back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't send it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late. I hate her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start to walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you should move back into the city? Get a new job. Shake it up a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah. Finley called me. He's starting up a new fund out here in May so I'm gonna wait for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That guy's starting another fund?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. He's an animal. He prints money. Come on, let's finish strong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry starts to run. Mike follows. After about thirty fee Mike pulls up. He's breathing is labored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just...hold up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike is really breathing hard now. He's making some funny noises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike just holds up a hand. He can't really speak.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mike, what the fuck? What's (Barely audible) wrong? Yeah. Fine. I just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drops to a knee. He's not alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy fuck! Mike? Hang on pal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry takes out his black berry but immediately fumbles i into the wet mud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck! Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs it and shakes it out but it's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta be kidding me. Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike is still wheezing. Terry turns his attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it your heart, buddy? Are you having a heart attack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! I'm not having a heart attack! I just...can't breathe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That could be a heart attack, Mike. You should lie down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry tries to help him but it's only seems to annoy Mike

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get off me! Just lie down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! It's wet. I don't want to lie down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who cares? You might be dying. Are you cold? Do you feel cold?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I'm lying on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look into my eyes, Mike. Look into my eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are now engaged in a weird wrestling match.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry looks to see TWO FORTY YEAR OLD WOMEN in jogging ge staring at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ambulance pulls away revealing Mike and Terry sitting the open back of Terry's LEXUS SUV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK dude, how long has that been happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couple of months. The doctor says it's stress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously? Did he prescribe anything for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Jogging. Why the hell you think I'm doing this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. That scared the shit out of me. What are you so stressed about, Mike?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Work. Money. Everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it that bad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. It is. I don't know how much longer I can keep my practice going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Holy shit, Mike! What're you gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no frickin' idea. I've been trying everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you told Jackie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet. I don't want to freak her out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good call. So we just need a new strategy, that's all. What about that Judge that's always throwing work your way? Can't she help you out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judge Lee, yeah. If it wasn't for her I'd probably be out of business already. I just need more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there anything else you can do for money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell am I gonna do? Bartend? I'm a lawyer, Ter. I practice law.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And it's not like I'm some I know. scumbag. I help old people for Christ sake. No offense but your pal, Finley doesn't give a crap about anything but making money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. But that's why he makes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shit, Ter. Thanks for the update.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The office is dark aside from Mike's desk light. Shelly i gone. Mike's blackberry rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, honey. I'm still at the office. Yeah. I came back after practice, I'll be home in a bit. (Checking his blackberry) Oh, hey, let me go, Jack. I've been waiting for this call. Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike hangs up the phone and answers his blackberry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Tom. Thanks for getting back to me. I'm good. I'm good. Yeah, I was just following up to see if you had any overflow. It's been a slow month on this end and I was...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike listens. The news from Dunleavy isn't good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. OK. No, yeah of course. I appreciate that. Thanks, Tom. Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike hangs up the phone and sits at his desk. After a mom he slams his hand on the desk. And then something catches eye. It's LEO POPLAR'S FILE. He opens the file and see's PAMPHLET FOR OAK KNOLL. He flips through the file and lan on a particular page and a particular line item.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monthly Commission: $1,508.00.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike walks with Leo Poplar up the steps of the courthouse

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leo walks through the metal detector. Mike watches him an then walks through himself but something beeps. The guard stops Mike. Leo starts to wander away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Leo. Leo hold on! (to the Guard) Can you stop him, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a very drab, no frills courtroom. JUDGE LEE is seate the bench looking over some documents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike is sitting next Leo. Seated at the next table is STU THATCHER, ATTORNEY FOR THE OFFICE OF PUBLIC GUARDIAN. Mik tapping his pen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any word from his daughter? Mr. Flaherty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh..no, Your Honor. I have the two certified letters returned unclaimed. And there is no phone number for her. We can't find her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she is the only living family, is that correct?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, your Honor, she is. But Mr. Poplar hasn't seen her for over twenty years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's late? She's probably at the store buying some crap or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike turns back to the Judge and shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, then as, Mr. Poplar has been deemed incapacitated by this court, I'm appointing the Office of Public Guardian to serve as the guardian for his person and property. Do you have the order for me to sign, Mr. Thatcher?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I do, Your Honor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then please approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thatcher stands and takes out the order. Mike's wheels ar spinning. He seizes his moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Honor, if it pleases the Court.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Mr. Flaherty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would be willing to serve as Mr. Poplar's guardian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Stopping.) Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long have you known him? Two weeks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike is suddenly put on the spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More like five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? And now you want to be his guardian?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike looks at Leo and the Judge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I approach, your honor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Council approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike collects himself and approaches.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE LEE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What's going on Mike?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well Judge, I think I'd be a better candidate then the state in this case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and stop saying really, it's annoying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE STENOGRAPHER raises in eyebrow.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Your Honor, I live in the Proximity hardly qualifies same town as Mr. Poplar... him as a guardian, Your Honor.

dialogues.text: Then you ride the crotch and break him down with a cross-face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vigman grabs Pill under the crotch, applies a stiff cross face and then drives him hard to the mat. Another Wrestle STEMLER chimes in. Stemler is wearing a STAR WARS t-shirt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh man, how'd that feel, Pill? We'll just call you "pancake"!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stemler's a bit off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Chewbaka.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, right. More like the "Secret Apprentice".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you, ten years old, Stemler?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike loses it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! We're trying to teach you guys something and you're all just goofing off. Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last time I checked we haven't won a match! Right coach?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's embarrassing, guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's embarrassing. But you're all acting like you don't care! Well, I'm not getting paid enough to just jerk around here. (gestures to Vig) I don't know about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not getting paid enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I care about what I do and so should you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I care!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So does coach Vig, and so should you! Run em, Coach. I can't look at them anymore!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go ladies!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike storms out past Kyle who watches him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike, Jackie, Abby and Kyle are eating dinner together. A is coloring. Mike watches Kyle as he finishes his big gla of milk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, have some more corn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives him the bowl of corn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get you some more milk too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle finishes off the corn. Jackie gets up for the milk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you call Fenn about the tree, Mike?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...yeah I did but Terry said he'd help and I think we can...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike. Don't start. You two are not cutting down that tree. Just call Fenn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella starts to cry on the BABY MONITOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to give her some Tylenol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Jackie is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to play croquet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When it's warm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike gets up and begins to load the dishwasher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy, can I watch TV?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...yeah but just for a half hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby leaves. Kyle turns to Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Mike, you think I could practice with you guys tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, if you want. Sure. And by the way, what I did in there today, yelling like that. I don't usually do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were right, they deserved it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Kyle are walking into the gym.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have wrestling shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about it. You ever wrestle before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vigman is already running the team through a drill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get that ankle. Get that ankle! Time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Vig. Alright, guys, listen up! Kyle's going to be working out with us for a little while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up Kyle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The team laughs. Kyle just nods to Stemler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carlos, you and Jimmy rotate him in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle nods and walks over to Carlos and Jimmy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. Let's go. Ten seconds to get an ankle. Then we switch it up. Ready? Wrestle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy sits against the wall and Mike blows his whistle ag the wrestlers all go at each other. Mike watches Kyle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves well. Fluidly. Carlos keeps trying to grab Kyle' ankle but Kyle easily defends against it. Mike checks his watch. Then blows his whistle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time. Switch. And...wrestle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike blows his whistle again and Kyle goes on the offensi He gives Carlos a quick head fake and before Carlos knows what's happened, Kyle has grabbed his ankle and tripped h down to the mat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carlos looks shocked. Kyle pops back up but stays focused Carlos. Mike looks to Vigman who raises an eyebrow, impressed. One thing is certain, Kyle can wrestle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle and Mike are walking toward the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have fun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When's the last time you wrestled?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you stop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just felt like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle just shrugs and Mike let's it go. They arrive at Mik car and Mike talks to Kyle over the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So let me ask you something, Kyle. How good are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle just looks at Mike, almost blank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm pretty good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike is looking at his computer screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike runs inside. It's a sparsely furnished bachelor pad all the toys.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: You check out that link I sent you?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Yeah. Kyle Timmons. That's the kid?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Yeah. That's the kid!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, right? Can you believe that?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry is in the den at his computer, reading excitedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit! He was thirty-five and one as a freshman!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. He finished second at the states. In Ohio!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike walks into the kitchen and grabs a beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This kid had seventeen pins. He's a killer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. It's nuts. And he quit after his freshman year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. He doesn't talk much. He's kind of a weird kid. Why can't I have one kid like that on my team? Just one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you talking about? You do. You have him. You can take this kid to the states, Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not on the team, Ter. He's not even a student. He's been here for three days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what? Enroll him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not enrolling him. He's just here until we reach his mother and figure this out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So he's gotta do something, right? Let him wrestle. Look at this way, you're helping out the old man and this kid's a little bonus for doing the right thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not just helping out the old man, Ter. It's not like it's charity work. I'm getting paid for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Shit, everyone gets paid, but think about it, Mike. What are the chances that this kid ends up on your door step and he can wrestle like that? It's a sign, pal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This lands with Mike. Terry sits down at his computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check this out. There's a video link of him wrestling in some tournament.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry presses play. It's grainy and amateur but good enou Mike looks on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at that kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike gets sucked in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. He's gonna throw him. Look, he's setting him up. He's setting him up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Terry explode. They high five and hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle is standing, waiting. Jackie walks out with her purs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's five dollars for lunch. I have no idea what it costs but let me know when you find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good for you. Save it. Now take this, it's too early to argue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle takes it. Mike arrives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. Let's go, pal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye Jackie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle leaves. Mike kisses Jackie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you sure we should do this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? Whether he's here for two more days or two weeks it gives him something to do all day. Unless you want him hanging out here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Kyle are waiting. After a moment, STEVE DELUCA, PRINCIPAL, emerges from his office and greets them. They walk into his office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike is working at his desk. Shelly opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Mike, we got a check from Leo Poplar's trust for $1,500 but it's made out to you and not the firm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. I'll take that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike gets up and takes the check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shouldn't I deposit it in the business account?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's not a legal fee. It's a personal fee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts on his coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I ended up taking on Leo's guardianship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I thought I mentioned that to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you definitely didn't mention that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, it just played out that way. I have to get going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns off his computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well can we put some of that in the business account so they don't take our copier back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh..not this time. Next month. Promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs his briefcase and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need our copier, Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Bye Shelly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that noise is getting louder. I'm not hung over today!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike walks out of the bank and dials his cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey honey. I'm good. Could you do me a favor and drop that health insurance check in the mail? I just forgot to mail it. Yeah, it's on my desk. Thanks. I'll call you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry is walking through the locker room. A few WRESTLERS BASKETBALL PLAYERS are getting dressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up Fella's? Hitting the showers, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sounded weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Vigman are in their office looking over a board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up? Hey Vig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Terry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think? I have to see this kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's incredible. Just incredible. And he's good to wrestle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. So what's next?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry pulls up a stool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're trying to figure out where he can wrestle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where ever the hell he wants, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Not right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle knocks at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Kyle. Come on in. How was school?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my friend Terry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry, pops up, a bit too excitedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey man! Nice to meet you! Really nice to meet you. Welcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike tries to cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the shoe's fit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So let me ask you something, Kyle. You think you might want to wrestle in a match?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. We have a match on Saturday. What do you wrestle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One-nineteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excellent. Done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is anyone there now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Jimmy Reed. But I think he might be better off at 125.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you think we should wrestle off?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE/TERRY/VIG
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KYLE's tying his NEW WRESTLING SHOES. The rest of the tea sitting around the mat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, let's go guys. Wrestle off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vig, you keep time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike holds up a stop watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry grabs the watch from Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't mind, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike gives Terry a look. Vig minds. Kyle and JIMMY REED s hands. And set themselves on their marks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready? And...wrestle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vigman blows his whistle and the room erupts in cheering. Most of it for Jimmy Reed except for Stemler who is rooti for Kyle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy and Kyle lock arms but Kyle pushes him away. Jimmy locks again but Kyle pushes him away again. Jimmy comes i hard this time and Kyle uses his momentum to quickly thro him to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy tries to scramble to his knees but Kyle is all over him. He quickly locks Jimmy in a cradle and rocks him ont his back. It looks easy. Vigman calls the pin. The room i quiet...except for Terry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike shoots Terry a look. Kyle helps Jimmy off the mat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good match.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't feel good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vigman turns to Mike and Terry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think we can teach him anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike, Terry, Kyle, Jackie and the kids are eating pizza.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know why we didn't quit. Just the smell of that room brought back the memories. I hated it, it was like a form of self-abuse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you guys that bad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike was average. I sucked. Sorry Abby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta stop by the office and deal with the computer. Should I...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'll take him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We both should have quit. Then we could have joined the ski club and gotten busy with Allison Shepard on the overnights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Yo! Terry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was busy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Uncle Terry is just silly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry Abby. Getting busy is bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle cracks up. Terry catches his eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry is sitting in Mike's office. A bottle of scotch and glasses on the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, how do you think we'd do against Kyle? Now?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: He'd kill us. Both of us. Together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you're right. The kid has man strength, dude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike emerges from under the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man strength?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. You know. Not kid strength. Man strength.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...I wouldn't say that around the locker room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trying to figure out what's wrong with my fricking back-up system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just call your IT guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have an IT guy. IT guys cost money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. I'm just gonna say what's on my mind. I want to be an assistant coach too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Why not? I'm value added. Especially compared to Vig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you value added?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well first of all I'm fun. No denying that. And secondly, unlike Vig, I actually used to wrestle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but Ter, you sucked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That doesn't matter, your team sucks. Plus I even look more like a coach then Vig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's not really value added.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Mike, I'm serious here. I need some distraction in my life right now. All I do is sit in my condo and think about Lori and that guy having sex in the jacuzzi I paid for. It's fucking unhealthy. I've been really kind of going crazy. Really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike looks at his friend. He can tell he's serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We start at 3:30pm. Don't be late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My brother! I will not let you down. To the team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry raises his glass. Mike toasts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what should I wear to practice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a singlet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, so we can see your man strength.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good one, Coach! See, it's already fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackie is hanging laundry. She hears a phone ringing from laundry room. She peeks around the corner and sees that K is not there. She crosses to his phone and picks it up. I reads "Mom". She answers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Hello, this Jackie Flaherty. Kyle is staying with us. Hello? (She closes the phone) I'm gonna kill that lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sets the phone down and turns. Kyle is standing on th stairs. His hair is wet and he's carrying his towel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Hi. I heard your phone ringing and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You answered it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, I saw it was your Mom and we've been waiting to hear from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd she say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She didn't say anything. She hung up. Have you talked to her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Can you not answer my phone anymore?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. OK. I can do that. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackie heads back to laundry room. She stops at the stair

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Here's a bucket. You shouldn't be smoking but if you do could you put the cigarettes in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I quit now that I'm wrestling

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Good. OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leaves. Kyle walks over the couch and picks up his ph

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Jackie are sleeping. A sound from downstairs. Th door opens and shut. Mike sits up and listens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that Abby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it is, she just ran away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike walks into the kitchen. Kyle is drinking water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you outside?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I went for a run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's pretty early. You do this every morning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In season, yeah. I like to get my run in early and then drill some moves for an hour before school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...so I'm gonna do it. See you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle walks downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike climbs back into bed. Jackie barely moves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was Kyle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Working out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he gonna do it every morning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In season. Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle takes off his shirt and stands on the scale wearing his underwear. He's lean and muscular. He has a TATOO on right arm and PAIR OF WINGS TATOO on his shoulder blades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus! Look at those tats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This kid is just fricking cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Timmons. One nineteen. Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The New Providence team jogs out to the mat. There are ma twenty people there. A PUNK ROCK SONG is playing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This song sucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rew picked it. He's an odd one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Vig, which kid is yours anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of them. He quit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? You're son quit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My step son and yes. Don't get me started, I thought becoming a coach might be a nice way for us to bond. He said it wasn't fierce and he quit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harsh. So why you still doing it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vig is leading by example. Winners never quit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, even if it sucks. This team is just depressing sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry sits next to Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's where I sit, Ter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry buddy. I got to be near, Mike. It's good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say's who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys. I don't think we should fight about our seats in front of the kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pioneers are getting beat. Carlos is wrestling and putting up a good fight but time is running out and he's by three points. He tries a desperate takedown but it backfires and the other wrestler picks up another two poi The buzzer sounds. Match over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The team gets up to greet Carlos. Kyle strips off his swe and buckles up his head gear. He walks up to Mike for a p talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. You ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This kid is good. So just...you know...be ready out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry gives Vigman a look. "Be ready?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you give me a slap?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me a slap. Across the face. Like your waking me up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike cuffs Kyle on the side of the head gear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you do it harder?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike slaps him hard. And Kyle sprints to the mat and take his stance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ref blows the whistle and the wrestlers circle each other. The OTHER WRESTLER is clearly on the offensive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Kyle. Take this punk out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Under his breath) Ter! Cut the shit! You're a coach. You're not sitting in the stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. I'm just excited. You know me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Other Wrestler shoots a single and takes Kyle down. T points.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Losing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's his first match. Give him a break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Other Wrestler is relentless. Kyle keeps trying to ge and the kid keeps breaking him down. Kyle stands up and O Wrestler slams him to the mat. Kyle is getting beat up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two Wrestlers go out of bounds and the Ref stops the action. Kyle gets up and Mike checks in with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! You OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle gets into the bottom position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he smile?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I think he did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. That's good, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ref blows the whistle and Kyle explodes to his feet, kicking a leg back between the Other Wrestler's legs. He lower's his body, reaches behind him and whips the Other Wrestler to the mat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drops down and puts him a double arm bar and runs the Other Wrestler right up over his own shoulders. The Ref d to the mat and calls the pin. Match over. The Team jumps and cheers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See. I'm good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's got nothing to do with luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle shakes the other wrestler's hands and the Ref raises hand in victory. Kyle crosses to the opposing coaches and shakes their hands. Then he runs to back to his bench. Mi greets him with a handshake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd that feel? Pretty good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, pretty good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike smiles and Kyle sits down. The next wrestler, Jimmy steps up to Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Can you slap me too, Coach?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike laughs. And then he slaps him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike, Kyle and Abby are watching TV. Jackie walks in putt on her coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to the market. I'll be back in a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I go with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...yeah OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle gets up to get his coat. Jackie looks at Mike who ju shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to go with Kyle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, honey. It's almost bed time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackie is shopping. Kyle catches up to her. He is carryin two BOXES OF CEREAL. He doesn't put them in the basket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coco Puffs. Is that your brand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's for Leo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice. Drop it in, it's on me. Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's he doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's doing OK. He can say some pretty funny things. Yesterday he told me I was fired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fired? For what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. He just fired me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I have to meet this Leo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. He's a pretty funny dude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have any home work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little but I already did it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impressive. You ever think about going to college?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah but just to wrestle. My old coach thought I could get a scholarship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I hear you're pretty good. So why'd you quit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle just shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to tell me. It's alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They keep walking. Jackie grabs a box of tacos from the shelf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you like tacos?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me, too. I make a mean taco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The team is jogging in circles around the mat. Mike, Vigm and Terry, stand in the middle of the circle talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go! Circle up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. I want to spend this week working on bottom position. Did you all see Kyle the other day? He exploded up. Kyle, show the guys what you did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle is caught off guard. He hesitates

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's kind of my own thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So can you share it with us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's not a move or anything, I just tell myself that the guy on top is going to take my head and shove it under water and kill me. And if I don't want to die on the bottom, I just gotta do what ever the fuck it takes to get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This kid is intense. His words really land with Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. So the move is called "whatever the fuck it takes." Let's go. Let's work on it. Come on. "Whatever the fuck it takes."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vigman claps and the wrestlers start to move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle sitting in the communal room at a table with Leo. Ky is doing homework. Leo is staring out the window. Court T playing in the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're mother didn't want to come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a tough kid that one. She tell you bad things about me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. But I never believe her anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should, she's your mother. Respect that. (Pointng to the TV) Can you turn that down? I hate that judge. I wouldn't be in this place if it wasn't for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But this place is pretty nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not my damn house! I paid for that house. Damn Judge. Turn it off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to take a walk outside, Leo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Let's go to my park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your park, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. My park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Kyle get out of the car and unload a couple of s mats from the backseat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bring the tape?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. It's in my bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike grabs his briefcase from the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Mike, can I ask you something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Of course. What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leo told me that some Judge made him move into that place. Is that true or is he just making that up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike wasn't expecting this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. That's true, pal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well because they can take good care of him there, Kyle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike's phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he wants to live at home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, pal. Hang on a minute. (Into cell phone) Hello? Yes. This is him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Can you hang for a moment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I have to take this. I'll be right in, OK? We can talk in a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle walks inside. Mike watches him go, already regrettin the lie. He exhales...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Sorry to keep you waiting. Yeah. How are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackie it the sink. Stella is eating. Mike is sitting at the table with a beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? She doesn't even know us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well I think she heard that I'm a lawyer and I have a family and that was good enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For how long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another month, I guess, until she gets out of rehab. She said that Craig guy took off. She sounded pretty shaky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe this lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackie joins Mike at the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I know. Where is he anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the basement with Abby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it is. So what do we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We let him stay. I don't know, do we even have a choice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess we don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A school bus drives through the New Jersey Farm country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle is siting on the bus listening to his Ipod. Stemler sitting next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You nervous?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not wrestling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I'm just nervous a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever think about wrestling in a match?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I'm just waiting for the green light from Coach. But I'm glad I'm not wrestling today. These guys are ranked fourth in the state. And you're wrestling Kenny Randall. He's undefeated. He is tough! Really tough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for letting me know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vigman stands up at the front of the bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Cut the chatter! You should all be playing the "what if" game. What if he shoots a single leg? What if he controls my wrists?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if we all get pinned like last year?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Stemler! Or I'll throw you off the bus myself!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vigman sits back down next to Terry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did they really pin all of you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just about. It's gonna be a fucking bloodbath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Multiple Pins. It's a bloodbath. Jackie, Abby and Stella in the stands and they look depressed. Kyle's next up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. This is Kenny Randall. He's very good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you have an advantage here, he has no idea who you are, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So he's gonna be overconfident. You take advantage of that and when you get your shot, put him away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle nods and Mike slaps him across the face and Kyle spr to his place on the mat and gets ready. Mike turns to the team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See how he runs out there? I want that kind of intensity from all of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did Daddy hit Kyle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ref blows the whistle and the match starts. As Mike predicted KENNY RANDALL tries to end the match quickly wi throw but Kyle is too strong and too good. Kyle counters throws Kenny to his back. Before anyone can blink, Kyle p him. Mike, Terry, and Vigman explode off their chairs.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yeah! Holy shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just pinned Kenny Randall. Are you kidding me?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenny Randall looks shocked. He throws off his head gear gets up. The MILBURN COACHES look equally shocked. The Re raises Kyle's hands. Kyle runs over to shake the Milburn Coaches hand and then he runs back to his bench and is greeted by Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He know's who I am now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike smiles as the team greets him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackie and Stella are sitting on the ground. Kyle walks i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, can I watch TV in here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah but I want to show you something. Stella, who's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She started saying it at the match today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. So I have to ask, those tatoo's must have hurt, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't lie to me. Look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackie lifts her pant leg. She has a small tatoo on her ankle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got it on Spring Break. Hurt like hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's it say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JBJ. Jon Bon Jovi. I'm a fan. You got a problem with that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I do not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was fun today. You're good. I'm glad you started wrestling again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No quitting this time, you got that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I tell you something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't quit my old team. I got thrown off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I stole a car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? You're don't even drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. That was part of the problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's car did you steal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A teacher's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was really stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. It was stupid. You could have killed yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Everything just got messed up after that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well we all do stupid things. But the best part is that you got a another chance and now you're kicking butt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's true. And you know who would agree with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackie lifts her leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope. JBJ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackie lifts her leg exposing her tatoo. Kyle smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pioneers race out onto the mat to do warm-ups before home match. They are fired up. There are more fans in the stands. Terry and Vig bob their head to the music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle looks up at Jackie, Shelly and kids who are also roc out in the stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle and Jackie walk through a park with Leo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wrestling team sprints through the empty hallways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle and Stemler are battling it out on the Wii. Stemler wearing a helmet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike pours himself some coffee. Jackie is feeding the kid

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The basement door opens and Kyle walks out followed by Feeney, Jimmy, Carlos, and Stemler. They are all sweating profusely. Mike is about to sip his coffee when Terry wal out. He nods and follows the gang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry and Kyle stand side by side holding onto two ropes. Mike is cutting down the dead tree with a chain saw. Jack Abby watch from the front porch. Mike finishes cutting an Terry and Kyle pull the tree over. Success. Mike lifts hi arms in triumph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike, Vigman and Terry are preparing for the match.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't have anyone at heavyweight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Korsic will be happy. Tell him now so he doesn't puke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why does he puke? He's a heavyweight. He doesn't have to lose weight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nerves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet Lord. This is a team for the ages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle knocks on the door. Stemler is with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up, guys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stemler wants to wrestle today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Coach. I'm pretty sure I'm ready. Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you gonna wrestle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He could wrestle 119. I could bump up and get a pin at 125 and Jimmy goes 130. Then we're only giving up one weight class and we got a shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vig and Terry look at Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh. Vig?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. He's right. It's possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever wrestled in a match before Stemler?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I have not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're just waiting for the green light, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. I think now is my time. I can feel the force.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three coaches all look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry holds up a CUP OF STICKS with weight classes writte them. The BERKLEY HEIGHTS COACH selects a stick and reads weight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One twenty-five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vigman reads off the roster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We start at 125 pounds. Depasquale and Timmons. We'll finish at 119 pounds. Tomlinson and Stemler.

dialogues.speaker: STEMLER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I'm ready Coach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Coaches all turn to see Stemler already wearing his singlet and headgear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the update Stemler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's gonna be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SCORE BOARD reads 33- 31. The 112 pound weight class wrestling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hook the arm! Carlos, hook the arm!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carlos does and holds on for the win. The team cheers. Mi turns to Vigman and Terry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How we doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that win, we're up by five. If Stemler doesn't get pinned, we win.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a huge fucking "if".

dialogues.speaker: STEMLER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I can hear you, Coach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all turn. Stemler is standing right there. He looks petrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good job, Ter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Stemler. You're a champ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here, Stemler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike takes Stemler by the shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been practicing for a long time. You're ready for this. You hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stemler nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you get in trouble out there, you just listen to me. I'm right here, OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stemler nods again. Too scared to respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. You are not going to get pinned! You hear me! No way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way. No way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Now I'm going to slap you. Ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah but not so hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike gives him an odd half-slap and Stemler runs out to t mat and takes his place at the line. The team cheers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But then the other WRESTLER runs out. He is wearing a BLA PROTECTIVE FACE MASK. Stemler spins away from the line an looks pleading at Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit! It's Darth Vader! Are you kidding me? No way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He does look like Darth Vader. But in a singlet.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE/TERRY/VIGMAN
dialogues.text: Don't worry. It's just a mask. You are ready! Get on that line. Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Stemler. Come here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stemler walks over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he's Darth Vader then you're the Secret Apprentice. You got this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stemler buys it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. You're right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stemler returns to the line slightly more confident. The blows the whistle and the match starts. Stemler is immediately taken down. Terry looks at his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's late in third period. Stemler is losing 13-0. Stemle is flat on his belly and he's getting mauled. The Ref cal him for stalling. One point. 14-0. Thirty seconds to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep moving, Stemler. Keep working!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Reading score card) Oh shit. Oh shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's one point away from a tech fall and we'd lose on criteria.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he falls behind by fifteen points it's a technical fall. They get five team points. If that happens the score would be tied but we'd lose the match on criteria.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike drops to the mat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stemler! Stemler!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stemler looks over. His eyes are wild.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to get up! He's trying to drown you! He wants you dead. But you are not going to die on the bottom! Do you hear me? Do you?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stemler manages a nod, albeit a terrified one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good! Now just do the move we worked on in practice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Stemler's confused look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Whatever the fuck it takes!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stemler almost manages a smile and then he hits "the move It's not pretty but somehow he manages to get up and out. team goes nuts. One point for Stemler. 15-1.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Other kid frantically tries to take him down but Stem holds him off dancing wildly around the mat. The buzzer sounds. The team goes nuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
