dialogues.text: The Ref raises the other wrestler's hand in victory but i Stemler who celebrates as if he just won the states. He r off the mat and into the arms of his teammates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Kyle walk through the empty hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm proud of what you did today. That win meant a lot to the guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool. It was good coaching with Stemler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike laughs. Then he just looks at Kyle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me ask you something. What's it like? Being as good as you are? What's it feel like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I guess it just feels like I'm in control. Of everything. You know what I mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I do. Must be nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DISTRICT TOURNAMENT. Kyle is ahead in points going in the second period. He chooses the top position. The Ref b the whistle and the OTHER WRESTLER sits out and Kyle simp sucks him onto his back. It almost looks too easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: District champ, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pure fucking poetry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ref slaps the mat and it's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle walks into Leo's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Leo. Guess who won the Districts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me. And Mike said he got a call from a college scout about me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Hi baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A THIRTY-EIGHT YEAR OLD WOMAN standing in the door way. T is CINDY TIMMONS. Kyle's mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came to get you, honey. And to see Grandpa. I missed you so much. Can I have a hug, baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle looks at Leo who just shrugs. Finally, he walks towa her but then veers away and runs from the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's he going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, he's just had to go somewhere, Dad. Do you want some juice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike is watching Stella who is playing on the ground. Jac comes up from the basement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's upset. I don't blame him. It's weird that she just shows up like that. (Checking her watch) And of course she's late, the druggie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey. Can you stop, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna talk to her, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I am. If you don't punch her first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Car lights in the window. Mike looks out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a cab. It's her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not my fault if I punch her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it is. That will be your fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackie picks up Stella. The door bell rings. Mike answers Cindy is standing there. She looks nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. I'm Mike Flaherty. Come in, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this is my wife, Jackie and my daughter, Stella.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Cindy. Nice to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's very cute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Abby, our six year old, is downstairs with Kyle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awkward pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to sit down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. This is a very nice house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you very much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I get you a drink or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackie shoots Mike a look. A drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water or soda or anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No thanks. I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. OK. So I'll go get Kyle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike starts to go but Cindy doesn't quite seem ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's he doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, he's doing really well. He's going to the high school here and he's wrestling on the team actually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? That's good. He loves wrestling so much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a really sweet kid. Our girls love him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy starts to tremble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am so sorry about this...it's just been such a difficult time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackie and Mike share a look. Then Jackie caves and slide over next to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh hey...these things happen, Cindy. And we've loved having him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike rolls his eyes. So much for beating the crap out of Abby walks upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, honey. This is Abby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Abby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby, can you go get Kyle for us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He left? What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He left out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Cindy are driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm really sorry about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know Kyle's doing really well with wrestling here, Cindy. The regions are this weekend and if he wins there then he goes to the states.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. It is and it could be really good for him. It might even mean a scholarship. Anyway, I was wondering if you could stay here for another three weeks until that's all over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy thinks about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to but don't think I can afford to stay in the hotel for that long. Do you think we could stay in my dad's house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not what Mike wanted but he's stuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhh...yeah. We could probably make that work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, yeah, I could stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. Good. That's great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike's phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey. Kyle's here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We found him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry looks into the other room. Kyle is playing on the W

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. We're playing Wii Golf. I'm destroying him. Dude, this kid really hates his mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike is driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, OK.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I mean like more then I hate my ex wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great, Ter. Thanks. Bye. (Mike hangs up) He went to my friend's house. We can go get him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I'll just go back to the hotel. It might just be too much for him tonight. I can see him tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I think maybe that's better. I know how Kyle can be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. I'll drop you off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike keeps driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Kyle are jogging. Kyle's mood is dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So when wrestling's over I have to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid so, pal. She's staying so you can finish the season. That's pretty nice of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They arrive back at Mike's house. Mike is really winded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told her you'd go see her today, Kyle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where ever you want. She could come here or we could go see her at Leo's house. She moving in this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle thinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go see her at Leo's before practice. But I want to go alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's OK but Kyle but you have to promise me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, Mike. I'll go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike turns and spots his OLD NEIGHBOR watching him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Betty. How's the foot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike is attempting to plunge the toilet. Shelly approache him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike? Cindy's here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Did she say why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. But she's here with an attorney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike gets up and opens the door to his office. Eleanor an Cindy stand to greet him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Cindy. Hi, I'm Mike Flaherty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, I'm Eleanor Cohen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leads them into his office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't aware that Cindy was represented by council.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She retained me last week to help sort out her father's situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last week? I thought she just arrived two days ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long have you been here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wanted a little time to settle in and spend some time with her father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how can I help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy has decided that she wants a more active role in her father's care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of a role is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to take care of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? So you want to move here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Cindy would like to bring her father back to Columbus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's where my support network is now. It's home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I'm not sure that's what Leo wants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already talked to him about it. He seem to like the idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand that, Cindy. But you haven't seen Leo in a long time and he's battling dementia now so it puts me in a tough position here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is the presumed Guardian, Mr Flaherty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we do hope to avoid litigation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So do I and I'm sure we can. Now, I'm sorry, but I actually have to go see a client so we'll have to set up another time to discuss this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle's still coming to see me today, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Of course. After school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have my office call. Come on Cindy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike nods and Eleanor and Cindy leave. Mike watches them CLANK. CLANK. CLANK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike walks out of the Convenience Store, around the corne and behind the store. He lights a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I don't get it. Is it that bad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Terry are standing outside talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's that bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just take her to court, you'll kill her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? She's a freaking mess. You're a pillar of the community, Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just can't go back in front of Judge Lee, it won't look good, trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So maybe you'll get a different judge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's the only Judge who handles these cases and if I look bad in front of her right now, I'm screwed. I'll have to close my fricking doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then dump it. Give her Poplar. It sucks but you've got your practice to worry about, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Incoming, dude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike turns. Kyle approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, pal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know she wants to take Leo back to Ohio?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. She just told me today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not gonna let her do that are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know Kyle. It's complicated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's complicated about it? She doesn't give a shit about Leo. They hate each other. You can't let her take him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. OK. Look, just go get ready for practice and I'll deal with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine but I told her I'm staying with you guys until we leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle leaves. Terry just looks at Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. What's your play?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea. I have no freaking idea!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's looking for a payout, dude. Just buy her stake and give her an exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just give her some of Leo's money and send her home. He's not gonna miss it. He's in happy land.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I can't do that. She's not even in his...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike stops. A flash of inspiration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. She's not and she doesn't and that's my play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your play?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike takes out his phone and dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about it. I just need to make a call. Can you get practice started?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? You want me to slap your face? Get you psyched up for the call?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I really don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike walks into the brick and glass tower.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Look, we're all concerned with what's best for Leo so I'm hoping we can settle this in an amicable way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike is siting down with Eleanor and Cindy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So do we.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, well, I thought I'd start by laying all the cards on the table, so maybe you can understand why I'm hesitating in turning Leo over to Cindy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy, your father disinherited you from his will. Completely. And I'm afraid that can't change now that he's been declared incapacitated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that true?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll have to see a copy of the will, Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I actually brought you a copy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike reaches into his briefcase and puts the A COPY OF TH WILL on Eleanor's desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who did he leave it too? Did he leave it to Kyle?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then who? You?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. He left everything to the municipal parks system. He wanted the town park dedicated in his name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That scumbag! He never cared about anyone but himself and his fucking money. Did you know about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy please!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Annoyed to Mike) I'd like to discuss this with my client, Mr. Flaherty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's to discuss? I'm not taking care of him if I'm not getting anything for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're finished here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike gets up and walks out. A smile creeps across his fac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackie, Gina and the kids settle into the bleachers. A LA BANNER reads NORTHEAST REGIONAL TOURNAMENT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Terry walking down the hallway eating SNICKER BA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brass balls, buddy. Brass balls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. And she's gone back to the motel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it is. Yeah, I think it worked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It totally worked. They opened their kimono and you made them eat the trade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't what know what your talking about half the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle is warming up. Vigman is watching. Mike and Terry en

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's time, Coach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle just walks out of the warm-up room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four men walk into the huge gym. It's packed. Kyle is completely focused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. This is big time. I bet there are scouts here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Definitely. And wait till we get to the states! Atlantic City here we come, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Atlantic City. Fierce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike smiles but then his smile fades. Cindy Timmons is standing against the wall. She steps forward and Kyle see

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle keeps his head down and keeps walking. Mike looks shocked but also keeps walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Kyle are face to face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me. One more win and we are going to the states. That's what counts. That's all that matters. You hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle nods. Mike can tell that he's half listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Kyle. Stay in this, OK. This is your place. You are in control, remember! You control it. Now go get him. Finish this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike slaps him. And Kyle races to the mat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wrestlers slap hands and THE REF blows the whistle. K immediately shoots in for a double leg. The Other Wrestle tries to sprawl but Kyle is in too deep. Kyle lifts him h and dumps him hard to the mat. The audience reacts and th Ref stops the action. The other wrestler bravely pops up he is obviously stung.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warning. Red. One point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle! Hey! Control! Control!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle looks at Mike and nods but his eyes are wild. The Re blows the whistle and Kyle and the Other Wrestler lock up They dance a bit and finally the Other Wrestler tries to Kyle up. Kyle back pedals and then literally throws the O Wrestler off the mat. The Ref has seen enough. He quickly issues Kyle his second warning and disqualifies him from match. It's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Other Wrestler pops up and runs at Kyle. Kyle respond The Coaches all intervene. It's a melee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle is sitting on the bench, perfectly still. Mike walks and sits down next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle stares at the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, it's alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike puts his arm on his shoulder and Kyle starts to cry. Mike squeezes him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to go with her. I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, pal. OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike, Terry and Kyle walk out of the school. The entire family is waiting for them. Jackie gives Kyle a big hug. takes his hand. They all get into their car. Mike is just about to get in but then he sees Cindy standing by her ca watching. He shuts his door and crosses to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to see my son wrestle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well your son had a pretty good chance to do something special in there. Maybe even change his life and that's gone now. I hope you're happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not my fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It isn't? Why do you think he lost his shit in there, huh?! What do you want, lady?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want my father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It didn't sound like that the other day. It sounded like you hated the guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have no idea what my father used to be like. No idea! He wasn't like he is now! He treated me like shit and he was all I had!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So now you want to return the favor? Is that it?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want that commission! That should be mine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's why you're doing all this? For fifteen hundred dollars a month?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't that why you did it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This stops Mike in his tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, I'll tell you what. You want the commission? You can have it. And you don't even have to take Leo. I'll take care of him for free and I'll send you the check every month. On one condition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You leave Kyle here. With us. Until he finishes high school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm his mother. He belongs with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure he feels that way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me what my son feels! He's coming with me and there isn't anything you can do about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you can't have that commission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll see about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike turns and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to see my son!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then call him! You have his number!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike sits on the back porch nursing a beer. Terry stands the yard facing away from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were right there, Mike. Right fucking there. And now we have nothing. Nothing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry screams. It's a primal scream. Mike just looks at h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry drinks. Mike watches him. Jackie pops out from the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike, your mom's here and dinner's almost ready. Have you seen Kyle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not in the basement?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll track him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Terry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a day, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry goes inside. Jackie sits next to Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we gonna do, Mike?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing to do. I can't stop her. She's gonna leave and she's gonna take Kyle and Leo with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you don't think you'd beat her in court?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? It's so obvious she's just wants him for the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike turns to Jackie. He wants to tell her but just can't

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just can't win this one, Jackie. Trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackie misinterprets Mike's guilt for pain. She backs off

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy is smoking next to the open window. She is nervous. knock on the door. She throws the cigarette out the windo and closes it. She checks herself in the mirror and opens door. Kyle is standing there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle, honey, come in. I'm so glad you came.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She steps back and he enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a seat, honey. Do you want a soda or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits on one bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits on the other facing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanted to say how sorry I was about the match and if I did anything to cause it then I will never forgive myself. I know how much wrestling means to you, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that why you called me. Just to tell me that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I also wanted to say that I'll do whatever you think is best for Leo. I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then leave him here. Where he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. I will. If that's what you want. But I have to be honest, I'm not sure that's what Leo wants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. Read this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands him a piece of paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the court transcript from when Leo was in court. My lawyer got it. Read the parts in yellow. See what it says.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle reluctantly reads it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't real. The Judge told Leo he had to live there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, honey. This is official from the court. It's what Mike said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle reads it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets paid for being Leo's guardian, Kyle. And then he just put him in that place so he didn't have to worry about him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle stares at the page.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leo belongs with us, Kyle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy is caught of guard by the question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why does he belong with us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy judges her son's look and speaks from the heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because we deserve that money, Kyle. Not some lawyer. You're a big boy. You can understand that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle looks at the page on more time and then suddenly, without warning, pounces on his mother pinning her to the bed. She screams. He gets in her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up! Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She finally quiets. Terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me! I don't care about this. It's all bullshit. Leave Leo alone. He belongs here. Do you hear me? Do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy can only cry and nod. Kyle grabs the paper and runs the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike paces around talking on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. Thanks, Karen. I appreciate it. Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackie walks into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not at Stemler's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is crazy, where could he be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, he's upset, maybe he went for a walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well we should take a drive, your mom can stay with the kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His phone rings. Jackie stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. Yes, this is him. What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A STAFF MEMBER is at the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, stay calm, we'll find him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay calm? You've lost my ward!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike! Calm down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down?! We are gonna sue you guys, silly. He's a laywer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Staff Member picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, he's definitely not on the premises. A lot of the time they just try to go home. We're about to go there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Jackie share a look and leave. Terry turns to so residents who are looking on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey folks, listen up! Watch out for each other.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Terry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike's car pulls up. They all get out and run up to the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a light on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's got to be him. Do have the key?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I didn't bring it with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They arrive at the front door. Mike tries the knob. It's locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike goes to edge of the porch, climbs up onto the railin and looks into the side window. Leo is sitting in a chair watching TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There he is!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watching TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he watching?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who cares?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leo? Hey Leo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike knocks on the window. Leo doesn't register it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not responding. Ring the bell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackie does. Leo still doesn't respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is freaking spooky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike climbs down back onto the porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should we break in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a key back at the office. I could go get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He seems it. He's just sitting there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the door opens. Leo is standing there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE/TERRY/JACKIE
dialogues.text: Hi./Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leo walks away. They all follow him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. That is very creepy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk into the house following Leo into the living ro He sits back in his chair and start watching TV again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You OK, Leo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leo just watches TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you get here, pal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike stoops over and tries to connect with Leo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you walk here, Leo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leo turns and looks at them as if he is about to speak. T all wait for his reply and then...

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I brought him here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all jump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle? You took Leo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you lost your mind?! We've been worried sick about him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About both of you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to worry about us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle walks out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. That's super spooky. Just saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle walks into the kitchen, he turns off a pot of boilin water and strains some pasta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle, What the hell are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Making spaghetti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you lost your mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle, why did you do this? Please just tell us. Leo needs to be in a home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is where he belongs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle he needs to be at Oak Knoll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle, we talked about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. We did! Listen to this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle takes a piece of paper out of his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike Flaherty: Mr. Poplar wants to live at home. Judge Lee: You can do that Mike? Mike Flaherty: Yes, I can. Really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackie takes it and looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's from the court.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you get this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From my mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's true isn't, Mike?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike can't answer. Kyle's seen enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're just like her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He runs out. They all give chase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike runs outside and see's Kyle crossing the lawn. He quickly catches up to him. Terry and Jackie follow close behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Hey, Kyle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle keeps walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey can you hold on a second?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave me alone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike grabs Kyle one more time. Kyle rips his arm away and tries to push Mike back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't touch me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike deflects Kyle and Kyle spills to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle gets up and starts to circle Mike. Mike has no choic but reciprocate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you let me explain?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Explain what? How you lied to me? How you lied to Leo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle head pumps. Mike takes the bait and jumps back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle wait... Watch the head fake!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle I don't want to wrestle you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle, stop for a minute. Keep your hands out, Mike. Hands out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry, stop it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just trying to help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not helping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle head fakes again but this time he's in. Before Mike knows what hits him, he's on his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow! Oh shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike, stop it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle is all over Mike. Mike's trying to fight back but it useless and even kind of pathetic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying to stop it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit out Mike! Sit out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Terry! Kyle, stop it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike gets up to hands and knees but Kyle drives him hard the ground.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ow! Shit! Ouch! He's getting killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you stop coaching and break that up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry rushes in and tries to pull Kyle off but he's lost Finally, he wraps his arms around Kyle and pulls him off. Kyle spins free and fronts Terry. Terry immediately puts his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the ref. I'm just the ref!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle turns and runs off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle! Stop! Please!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't stop. Jackie turns to Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that true, Mike?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why'd you move him if he wanted to stay here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because it would have been too much work to leave him here. I couldn't have done it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you shouldn't have taken him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to, alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I needed the money! We needed the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You moved an old man out of his house to make money? Have you lost your freaking mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! I just didn't think it would get this complicated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Or you just didn't think you'd get caught?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This stops Mike in his tracks. He can't answer. Jackie tu and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack! Jack, where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Home!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stemler is sleeping on one couch. Kyle on the other. Kyle cell phone rings. He wakes up and checks it. He answers i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. Hello. Mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not there. He hangs up. Kyle starts to put on his shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did your mom just crank call you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you and Coach Mike get in a fight because you lost?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. We got in a fight because he's an asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, really, Stem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I'm sure he'll make it up to you, bro. You're the best wrestler he's ever had. I mean he's always been cool to me and I suck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This comment lands with Kyle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike is sleeping on a love seat. He wakes up. Leo is sitt there watching him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Leo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I fell asleep. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry for what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a big question. Mike cuts to the chase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to go home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackie is sitting with Stella and a cup of coffee. The fr door opens and closes. Mike walks into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Is he here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. He slept at Stemler's. How about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oak Knoll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right, that's not who I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go court.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't. You told the Judge you were keeping Leo at home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So then tell her you changed your mind. No one can question that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because it's not true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I'm glad your done lying now, just in time to lose your practice. That's how we survive, Mike. Your family. You ever think of that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. All the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackie quickly crosses to the sink. She starts to clean. breaks something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She braces herself against the sink and exhales. Mike jus watches her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Jack. I really am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A noise from the basement. Mike heads down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackie and Mike walk downstairs. Kyle is angrily gatherin his stuff and putting it in his back pack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Kyle. How'd you get down here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you hungry? I was gonna make some pancakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm leaving. I just came to get my shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They share a look and walk over to Kyle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle, listen, I just wanted to say I'm sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, Mike, you're sorry. Everyone's always sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I moved Leo back home, Kyle. And I'm gonna fight to keep him there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too late. You'll lose. My mother's gonna take him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe but I'm still gonna try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what?! You want me to forgive you now? Is that it, Mike?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I just want you to give me another chance. That's all I'm asking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike's sincerity is undeniable. Kyle looks to Jackie. The connect. Kyle shakes his head, turns around, and then thr his bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is bullshit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike looks at Jackie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Kyle, listen -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to be alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Without looking at them)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. All right. Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackie and Mike turn and start to walk upstairs but Jacki stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle, I just wanna say - we love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle keeps his back turned to them as they continue up th stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tight on the Baby Monitor. We hear Stella crying and Jack talking to Abby.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Abby, just pick a shirt and put it on. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike is sitting alone at the kitchen table drinking a cup coffee. The remnants of a pancake breakfast are on the ta There is one clean plate where Kyle usually sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment, Kyle comes up from the basement and sits at the table without saying anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just looks at Mike. Then he serves himself a few panca Mike passes him the bottle of syrup. He takes it and puts some on his pancakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He eats. Mike watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group is walking up the front steps of the court hous Terry joins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, I'm your assistant coach. And just notice who isn't here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen Vigman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry puts his arm on his friend's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole gang is walking toward to the courtroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike turns. Eleanor approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Eleanor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I talk to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Eleanor step to the side. She looks at Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know the transcript alone is enough to hang you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, we'll see what happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eleanor just looks at him, Judge and Jury. Mike blinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shame on you counselor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. My client would like to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Eleanor walk over to Cindy. She is barely holdin together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Cindy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Is your deal still available?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike tries to conceal his shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Kyle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy and Eleanor share a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then yes. It is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you'll send me the checks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every month.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You take good care of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to say goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike turns and waves Kyle over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle look to Jackie who gives him the OK. He walks over a Mike steps away. He just looks at his mother. She gently touches his face. He doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone looks on as Cindy says a few words to Kyle, hugs hard and then quickly turns and walks away. Kyle watches go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A croquet ball hits a stick.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Your turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby, Kyle, and Stemler are playing on the front lawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Don't rush me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stemler hits a shot and the ball goes into the garden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This mallet is crap! You see that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike pulls up and gets out of his car, wearing a suit and carrying his briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi guys!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Daddy. I'm winning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up, coach? Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's great, honey. Kyle, can you drag those garbage cans to the side of the house for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, pal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He runs inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike drops his briefcase and takes off his coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Honey.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: How was work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. I got stuck at the office with a client.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackie walks in from the other room, gives Mike a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, Shelly called. Oh, I dropped off the fan at Leo's today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for doing that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike heads upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be right back down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have time to eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll eat there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make sure you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike takes off his suit and throws it on the bed. He puts a casual button down blue shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a hard look himself in the mirror, almost as if steeling himself for something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry walks in and crosses to the bar. He sits down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I get a banana daiquiri, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bartender turns. It's Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike opens a beer and sets it down in front of Terry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want an umbrella with that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah. I'm good. But keep these coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike checks a ticket and prepares two drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how you doing, pal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me? I'm pretty good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hold on Mike as he continues to work.
